Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Bulgaria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Bulgaria 
    Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "The Juche Philosophy Is an Original Revolutionary Philosophy" was brought out in pamphlet by the Narodna Tribuna Publishing House of Bulgaria.
 The work, published on July 26, Juche 85 (1996), makes a scientific analysis of the limitation of the times when the preceding philosophies were set out and the originality of the Juche philosophy and clarifies the idea that the Juche philosophy serves as the revolutionary and political philosophy of the Workers' Party of Korea. It also clarifies the principled issues arising in studying and explaining the Juche philosophy.

Greetings to Philippine President
articles.content:
Greetings to Philippine President 
    Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Gloria Macapagal Arroyo, president of Philippines, on Sunday on the occasion of the 108th anniversary of its independence.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in different fields in the future, the message wholeheartedly wished the president success in her work for the country's stability and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Moammer el Gaddafi
articles.content:
Greetings to Moammer el Gaddafi 
    Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Moammer el Gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution of Libya, on the occasion of the 36th anniversary of the dismantlement of the U.S. military base in Libya.
 In the message Kim wished the Libyan leader and people greater success in their work to defend the national dignity and sovereignty and achieve the country's progress and prosperity, expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to Philippine FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Philippine FM
    Pyongyang, June 11 (KCNA) -- Paek Nam Sun, foreign minister of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Alberto G. Romulo, foreign minister of Philippines, on the occasion of the 108th anniversary of its independence.
 The message wished the Philippine foreign minister success in his responsible work, expressing the belief that the ties between the two countries would more favorably develop in the future through the close cooperation between the two foreign ministries.

Reception Given by Russian Ambassador to DPRK
articles.content:
Reception Given by Russian Ambassador to DPRK
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Russian Ambassador to the DPRK Andrei Karlov gave a reception on Friday on the occasion of the national day of the Russian Federation.
 Present on invitation were Rim Kyong Man, minister of Foreign Trade, Kim Jong Gak, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairperson of the Korean-Russian Friendship Association, Hong So Hon, president of Kim Chaek University of Technology and chairman of the Korea-Russia Friendship Parliamentary Group, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
 On hand were staff members of the Russian embassy.    
 Speeches were made there.

Greetings to Portuguese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Portuguese President
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Anibal Cavaco Silva, president of Portugal on the occasion of its national day.
 Expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the Portuguese people prosperity and well-being.

articles.title: Congratulations to Peruvian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Peruvian President
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to the president elect of Peru, Alan Garcia Perez.
 The message said that his election as Peruvian president is an expression of the deep trust and expectation of the Peruvian people.    
 It wished him new success in his work, reaffirming the will of the DPRK to invariably develop its relations with Peru.

articles.title: Congratulations to Colombian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Colombian President
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on June 8 sent a congratulatory message to Alvaro Uribe Velez on his reelection as president of Colombia.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably in the mutual interests, the message wished him good health and happiness.

articles.title: Congratulations to Lao President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Lao President
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme Peoples' Assembly, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Choummaly Saygnasone on his election as president of Laos at the first session of the 6th National Assembly of Laos.
 The message said that his election is an expression of the deep trust and expectation of the Lao party, government and people.    
 In the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, too, in the common interests of the two peoples, it wholeheartedly wished him good health and happiness as well as fresh success in his responsible work for prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Lao Prime Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Lao Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, June 10 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Bouasone Bouphavanh, on his appointment as prime minister of Laos.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to consolidate, the message heartily wished him good health and happiness as well as great success in his responsible work for development of Laos.    
 Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun also sent a congratulatory message to Thongloun Sisoulith on his appointment as vice-prime minister and foreign minister of Laos.
